title: 106_s3
content:
The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" includes a 10 percent reduction in individual income tax rates. No amendment made by this Act will be considered a change in tax rates for tax purposes. The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" includes a 10 percent reduction in individual income tax rates for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses. For taxable income levels ranging from $43,050 to $283,150, the tax rates range from 13.5% to 32.4% with specific dollar amounts for each bracket. For heads of households, a tax is imposed on taxable income according to a specific table. The tax rate is $76,759.65 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. For heads of households, the tax rate is based on taxable income according to a specific table. If taxable income is not over $34,550, the tax is 13.5% of taxable income. If it is over $34,550 but not over $89,150, the tax is $4,664.25 plus 25.2% of the excess over $34,550. If it is over $89,150 but not over $144,400, the tax is $18,423.45 plus 27.9% of the excess over $89,150. If it is over $144,400 but not over $283,150, the tax is $33,838.20 plus 32.4% of the excess over $144,400. For unmarried individuals (other than surviving spouses and heads of households), a tax is imposed on taxable income based on a specific table. The tax rate is $78,793.20, plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. For unmarried individuals, the tax rates based on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $25,750: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $25,750 but not over $62,450: $3,476.25 plus 25.2% of the excess
- Over $62,450 but not over $130,250: $12,724.65 plus 27.9% of the excess
- Over $130,250 but not over $283,150: $31,640.85 plus 32.4% of the excess For married individuals filing separate returns, the tax rates based on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $130,250: $31,640.85 plus 32.4% of the excess
- Over $130,250 but not over $283,150: $81,180.45 plus 35.64% of the excess For taxable income over $21,525, the tax rates are as follows:
- Over $21,525 but not over $52,025: $2,905.87 plus 25.2% of the excess
- Over $52,025 but not over $79,275: $10,591.87 plus 27.9% of the excess
- Over $79,275 but not over $141,575: $18,194.62 plus 32.4% of the excess
- Over $141,575: Varies For taxable income over $141,575 for estates and trusts, a tax is imposed at $38,379.82, plus 35.64% of the excess. For taxable income over $1,750, the tax is 13.5% of taxable income. For income over $4,050 but not over $6,200, the tax is $815.85 plus 27.9% of the excess. For income over $6,200 but not over $8,450, the tax is $1,415.70 plus 32.4% of the excess. Over $8,450, the tax is $2,144.70 plus 35.64% of the excess. Inflation adjustment amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 were made, changing the years from 1992 to 1998 in various provisions. In various provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, the years were changed from 1992 to 1998 by striking and inserting. Section 42(h)(6)(G)(i) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by changing the year from 1987 to 1998. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change the year from 1987 to 1998 in various sections, including section 132(f)(6) and section 1(g)(7)(B)(ii)(II). Additionally, section 1(h) is amended to change the percentage from 28 percent to 13.5 percent in certain paragraphs. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change percentages in various sections, including section 531, 541, 3402(p)(1)(B), and 3402(p)(2). Percentages are updated from 39.6 percent to 35.64 percent, and from 7, 15, 28, or 31 percent to 7, 13.5, 25.2, or 27.9 percent. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change percentages in various sections, including section 531, 541, 3402(p)(1)(B), and 3402(p)(2). The updated percentages are 35.64 percent, 13.5 percent, 25.2 percent, and 27.9 percent for different sections. Effective dates for these changes apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1998. Amendments to withholding provisions made by subsection (c) apply to amounts paid after December 31, 1998.
